title: How to Bake Thunder Cake

steps.headline: In a large bowl going one ingredient at a time, cream together the shortening, sugar, vanilla, egg yolks, water and tomato puree.
steps.description: Beat egg whites until they are stiff, then fold in.

steps.headline: In a separate bowl: sift the flour, cocoa, baking soda, and salt together.
Combine the dry ingredients into the large bowl with the creamy mixture.
Pour batter into a 8 1/2 inch pan (about 22 cm) and bake for 35 to 40 minutes.
Remove from oven and test if it's cooked all the way through with a toothpick.
steps.description: If it's finished, allow it to cool on the counter or a wire rack. Otherwise, continue the baking in short, 3-5 minute intervals.

steps.headline: Frost with chocolate butter cream frosting, chocolate ganache frosting, or about any other kind of chocolate frosting out there!
Strawberries are a MUST.
steps.description: Decorate the cake with tons of strawberries wherever and however you please; whole, halved, sliced, mushed up into a pulp! Just make sure it looks gorgeous! (Or at least have fun decorating?)

steps.headline: Slice it up and serve!
steps.description: It's a fantastic cake to bake and eat!

text: Preheat oven to 350˚  In a large bowl going one ingredient at a time, cream together the shortening, sugar, vanilla, egg yolks, water and tomato puree. Beat egg whites until they are stiff, then fold in. In a separate bowl: sift the flour, cocoa, baking soda, and salt together. Stir well. Combine the dry ingredients into the large bowl with the creamy mixture. Stir together. Pour batter into a 8 1/2 inch pan (about 22 cm) and bake for 35 to 40 minutes.  Remove from oven and test if it's cooked all the way through with a toothpick. If it's finished, allow it to cool on the counter or a wire rack. Otherwise, continue the baking in short, 3-5 minute intervals. Frost with chocolate butter cream frosting, chocolate ganache frosting, or about any other kind of chocolate frosting out there! The richer the better! Strawberries are a MUST. Decorate the cake with tons of strawberries wherever and however you please; whole, halved, sliced, mushed up into a pulp! Just make sure it looks gorgeous! (Or at least have fun decorating?) Slice it up and serve! It's a fantastic cake to bake and eat! Finished.
